thread.title: Auli'i Cravalho Sings Precious 'How Far I'll Go' Duet With 4-Year-Old Girl
thread.title_full: Auli'i Cravalho Sings Precious 'How Far I'll Go' Duet With 4-Year-Old Girl

author: Abigail Williams
title: Auli'i Cravalho Sings Precious 'How Far I'll Go' Duet With 4-Year-Old Girl
text:
Auli'i Cravalho Sings Precious 'How Far I'll Go' Duet With 4-Year-Old Girl THE FEELS, we have all of them! By Abigail Williams 
Auli’i Cravalho has had a big week. The 16-year-old “Moana” star got hit in the head mid-song at the Oscars, and still managed to deliver the performance of a lifetime. Less than 24 hours later, Cravalho landed a role in the NBC pilot “Drama High.” Now, she’s giving us an extra dose of the feels with a positively precious duet. 
Cravalho paired up with 4-year-old Claire Ryann to sing “How Far I’ll Go” for an “Ellen DeGeneres Show” segment Monday. Claire Ryann is one half of the daddy-daughter duo who went viral for their performance of “You’ve Got a Friend in Me.” Aside from being completely adorable, Claire has quite an impressive singing voice. 
From the second Cravalho and Claire start singing, you’ll be spellbound. Watch their full performance below.
